result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle William Gauger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Disarming a Peace Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.21.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds and wages under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  All applicable fees of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.
**Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to the Racine County case 12CF847; and concurrent with the Waukesha County case 13CF1029*; and consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle William Gauger in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Kyle William Gauger in custody.  Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  
State has satisfied victim notification.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Michael G, Marcia G
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to the Racine County case 12CF847 and CONCURRENT with the Waukesha County case 13CF1309, and CONSECUTIVE  to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.
*
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment.
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds and wages under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Amended first page of PSI report, received and filed
Letters of support on behalf of the defendant, received and filed

Defendant Kyle William Gauger in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Kyle William Gauger in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
As to Count 2:  Pursuant to negotiations Court dismissed and read in the charge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample
Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court, defendant Kyle William Gauger not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle William Gauger in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Kyle William Gauger in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Letter from Attorney Patrick K. Cafferty advising court of the defendant's new address.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kyle William Gauger in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Kyle William Gauger in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
